clusters.title: Netanyahu requests pardon from Israeli president during his ongoing corruption trial
clusters.neutral_headline: Netanyahu Requests Pardon in Corruption Trial
bullet_summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the request would help unify the country at a time of momentous changes in the region
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted a request for a formal pardon amid a yearslong corruption trial, just weeks after President Donald Trump said he should be pardoned
“Today, my lawyers submitted a request for clemency to the President of the State,” Netanyahu said in a video address posted on X Sunday
“The continuation of the trial is tearing us apart from within, provoking fierce divisions, intensifying divisions,” he said

items.title: Netanyahu requests pardon from Israeli president during his ongoing corruption trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday asked the country’s president to grant him a pardon from corruption charges, seeking to end a long-running trial that has bitterly divided the nation.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday asked the country’s president to grant him a pardon from corruption charges, seeking to end a long-running trial that has bitterly divided the nation.

items.title: Israel’s Netanyahu seeks pardon to end corruption trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked the country’s president on Sunday for a pardon in his long-running corruption trial, arguing that the criminal proceedings were hindering his ability to govern and that a pardon would be good for Israel. Under Israeli law, however, the president does not have the power to pardon someone who is not a convicted criminal, FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky said, noting that no verdict has yet been rendered on Netanyahu, who is actively seeking to prevent his trial from reaching its conclusion.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked the country’s president on Sunday for a pardon in his long-running corruption trial, arguing that the criminal proceedings were hindering his ability to govern and that a pardon would be good for Israel. Under Israeli law, however, the president does not have the power to pardon someone who is not a convicted criminal, FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky said, noting that no verdict has yet been rendered on Netanyahu, who is actively seeking to prevent his trial from reaching its conclusion.

items.title: Netanyahu requests Israel’s president grant a pardon in corruption cases
items.standfirst: Benjamin Netanyahu has requested a formal pardon from President Isaac Herzog in his long-running corruption cases.
items.content: Benjamin Netanyahu has requested a formal pardon from President Isaac Herzog in his long-running corruption cases.

items.title: Netanyahu submits formal request for pardon in long-running corruption trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the request would help unify the country at a time of momentous changes in the region.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the request would help unify the country at a time of momentous changes in the region.

items.title: Netanyahu seeks pardon on corruption charges after getting Trump's backing
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted a request for a formal pardon amid a yearslong corruption trial, just weeks after President Donald Trump said he should be pardoned.“Today, my lawyers submitted a request for clemency to the President of the State,” Netanyahu said in a video address posted on X Sunday.“The continuation of the trial is tearing us apart from within, provoking fierce divisions, intensifying divisions,” he said.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted a request for a formal pardon amid a yearslong corruption trial, just weeks after President Donald Trump said he should be pardoned.“Today, my lawyers submitted a request for clemency to the President of the State,” Netanyahu said in a video address posted on X Sunday.“The continuation of the trial is tearing us apart from within, provoking fierce divisions, intensifying divisions,” he said.

items.title: Benjamin Netanyahu asks Israel’s president for pardon in corruption case
items.standfirst: Request is submitted weeks after Donald Trump called on Isaac Herzog to pardon Israeli prime ministerBenjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president for a pardon for bribery and fraud charges and an end to a five-year corruption trial, arguing that it would be in the “national interest”.Isaac Herzog’s office acknowledged receipt of the 111-page submission from the prime minister’s lawyer, and said it had been passed on to the pardons department in the ministry of justice. The president’s legal adviser would also formulate an opinion before Herzog made a decision, it added. Continue reading...
items.content: Request is submitted weeks after Donald Trump called on Isaac Herzog to pardon Israeli prime ministerBenjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president for a pardon for bribery and fraud charges and an end to a five-year corruption trial, arguing that it would be in the “national interest”.Isaac Herzog’s office acknowledged receipt of the 111-page submission from the prime minister’s lawyer, and said it had been passed on to the pardons department in the ministry of justice. The president’s legal adviser would also formulate an opinion before Herzog made a decision, it added. Continue reading...

items.title: Netanyahu asks Israeli president for pardon to end corruption case
items.standfirst: Isaac Herzog’s office says it will consider the ‘extraordinary request’, which is expected to have significant political and legal implications
items.content: Isaac Herzog’s office says it will consider the ‘extraordinary request’, which is expected to have significant political and legal implications

items.title: Benjamin Netanyahu seeks pardon from Israel's president
items.standfirst: He denies any wrongdoing in three ongoing trials over allegations of bribery, fraud and breach of trust.
items.content: He denies any wrongdoing in three ongoing trials over allegations of bribery, fraud and breach of trust.

items.title: Israeli PM Netanyahu turns to president for pardon in ongoing trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president to grant him a pardon amid his long-running corruption trial, which has bitterly divided the country. After requesting multiple delays in the proceedings, Netanyahu has put himself in what FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky described as a “paradoxical situation.” He previously persuaded the Supreme Court to allow him to run for office, yet now argues it is impossible for him to testify while leading the country, Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president to grant him a pardon amid his long-running corruption trial, which has bitterly divided the country. After requesting multiple delays in the proceedings, Netanyahu has put himself in what FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky described as a “paradoxical situation.” He previously persuaded the Supreme Court to allow him to run for office, yet now argues it is impossible for him to testify while leading the country, Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.

items.title: Netanyahu submits request for a pardon during his ongoing corruption trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)

items.title: Netanyahu seeks pardon from Israeli president in corruption case
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday submitted a formal pardon request in his long-running corruption cases to the Israeli presidential office. The extraordinary appeal is now under review by President Isaac Herzog, whose office said the decision carries “significant implications.” Dozens of protesters demonstrated outside Herzog's private home in Tel Aviv, urging him to reject Netanyahu's request.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday submitted a formal pardon request in his long-running corruption cases to the Israeli presidential office. The extraordinary appeal is now under review by President Isaac Herzog, whose office said the decision carries “significant implications.” Dozens of protesters demonstrated outside Herzog's private home in Tel Aviv, urging him to reject Netanyahu's request.

items.title: Israel’s Netanyahu urges president to pardon corruption cases
items.standfirst: Israeli leader is up against three cases of corruption, including receiving hundreds of thousands of dollars in gifts.
items.content: Israeli leader is up against three cases of corruption, including receiving hundreds of thousands of dollars in gifts.

items.title: Netanyahu submits request to Israeli president to pardon him
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is facing a long-running corruption trial, has submitted an official request to the country's president to pardon him.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is facing a long-running corruption trial, has submitted an official request to the country's president to pardon him.

ai_summary: Benjamin Netanyahu requested a pardon from Israel's president on Sunday.
The request aims to end a long-running corruption trial.
Netanyahu believes the trial divides the nation.
The president cannot pardon someone not yet convicted.
Netanyahu's lawyers submitted a clemency request.

clusters.title: Rubio has ‘very productive’ peace discussions with Ukrainian officials
clusters.neutral_headline: US and Ukraine Officials Discuss Peace in Florida
bullet_summary: A meeting between US and Ukrainian officials in Florida on Sunday was "very productive," US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said, adding that work still remains towards ending Russia's war in Ukraine
Reported by NBC World, BBC World, CBS News and others

items.title: Rubio has ‘very productive’ peace discussions with Ukrainian officials
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Ukrainian officials in Florida for a round of peace discussions. Rubio called it a “very productive session” but also noted “much more work remains.”
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Ukrainian officials in Florida for a round of peace discussions. Rubio called it a “very productive session” but also noted “much more work remains.”

items.title: Ukraine talks 'productive' but more work needed, Rubio says
items.standfirst: American and Ukrainian delegations meet in Florida to discuss the outlines of a peace deal with Russia.
items.content: American and Ukrainian delegations meet in Florida to discuss the outlines of a peace deal with Russia.

items.title: Rep. Mike Turner says "you can't be America first and pro-Russia"
items.standfirst: The team of Ukrainian negotiators began meeting Sunday morning with Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, President Trump's son-in-law.
items.content: The team of Ukrainian negotiators began meeting Sunday morning with Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, President Trump's son-in-law.

items.title: Rubio Calls Ukraine Talks Productive as Witkoff Heads to Russia
Ukrainian and US officials meet in Florida to discuss proposals to end Russia’s war
items.standfirst: Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner meet Kyiv delegation amid more deadly Russian attacks in UkraineUkrainian negotiators have met US officials in Florida to thrash out details of Washington’s proposed framework to end Russia’s war in Ukraine, as Kyiv faces pressure on military and political fronts.The secretary of state, Marco Rubio; the special envoy, Steve Witkoff; and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s son-in-law; sat down with a Ukrainian delegation on Sunday before planned US talks this week in Moscow with Vladimir Putin. Continue reading...
items.content: Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner meet Kyiv delegation amid more deadly Russian attacks in UkraineUkrainian negotiators have met US officials in Florida to thrash out details of Washington’s proposed framework to end Russia’s war in Ukraine, as Kyiv faces pressure on military and political fronts.The secretary of state, Marco Rubio; the special envoy, Steve Witkoff; and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s son-in-law; sat down with a Ukrainian delegation on Sunday before planned US talks this week in Moscow with Vladimir Putin. Continue reading...

items.title: Rubio says US-Ukraine talks on ending war ‘productive’ but ‘complicated’
items.standfirst: Delegations meet in Florida to ‘create pathway’ for sovereign Ukraine ahead of US special envoy Witkoff’s Moscow trip.
items.content: Delegations meet in Florida to ‘create pathway’ for sovereign Ukraine ahead of US special envoy Witkoff’s Moscow trip.

items.title: Rubio says US-Ukraine talks on Russia war were productive but much work remains in search of a deal
items.standfirst: U.S. and Ukrainian officials completed roughly four hours of talks aimed at finding an endgame to the war between Russia and Ukraine.
items.content: U.S. and Ukrainian officials completed roughly four hours of talks aimed at finding an endgame to the war between Russia and Ukraine.(Image credit: Terry Renna)

items.title: Trump officials to sit down with Ukrainian negotiators in Florida
items.standfirst: Top Trump administration officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend. The meeting comes after the resignation of Ukraine's top negotiator and chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, due to an anti-graft probe. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg brings you the latest.
items.content: Top Trump administration officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend. The meeting comes after the resignation of Ukraine's top negotiator and chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, due to an anti-graft probe. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg brings you the latest.

items.title: Rubio and Witkoff to meet with Ukraine's negotiators in Florida
items.standfirst: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and setting the stage for key talks planned this week in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, the son-in-law of US President Donald Trump, were expected to sit down with a Ukrainian delegation to further hash out the details of a proposed peace framework.
items.content: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and setting the stage for key talks planned this week in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, the son-in-law of US President Donald Trump, were expected to sit down with a Ukrainian delegation to further hash out the details of a proposed peace framework.

items.title: Too many cooks? Trump’s growing army of Ukraine negotiators
items.standfirst: With the quartet of Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner and Daniel Driscoll, US President Donald Trump’s team of negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine seems to be growing by the minute. And they are all throwing their own ideas and strategies into the mix. Facing them is Russian President Vladimir Putin's trusted aide Kirill Dmitriev, whose diplomatic one-man show has steadfastly advanced the Kremlin’s demands.
items.content: With the quartet of Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner and Daniel Driscoll, US President Donald Trump’s team of negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine seems to be growing by the minute. And they are all throwing their own ideas and strategies into the mix. Facing them is Russian President Vladimir Putin's trusted aide Kirill Dmitriev, whose diplomatic one-man show has steadfastly advanced the Kremlin’s demands.

items.title: Live: Rubio says US-Ukraine talks were 'very productive' but more work needed to reach peace deal
items.standfirst: A meeting between US and Ukrainian officials in Florida on Sunday was "very productive," US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said, adding that work still remains towards ending Russia's war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, a Russian drone attack has killed one person and wounded 11 on the outskirts of Kyiv. Follow the latest updates on FRANCE 24's liveblog.
items.content: A meeting between US and Ukrainian officials in Florida on Sunday was "very productive," US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said, adding that work still remains towards ending Russia's war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, a Russian drone attack has killed one person and wounded 11 on the outskirts of Kyiv. Follow the latest updates on FRANCE 24's liveblog.

ai_summary: Marco Rubio met with Ukrainian officials in Florida.
Discussions focused on potential peace deal outlines.
Steve Witkoff is heading to Moscow for talks.
Jared Kushner also attended the Florida meetings.
Talks aimed at finding an endgame to the war.

clusters.title: What is driving US President’s Trump’s actions against Venezuela?
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Orders Venezuela Airspace Closed
bullet_summary: President Trump said that the airspace "above and surrounding Venezuela" was "closed in its entirety"
In response, the Venezuelan government said his comments violate international law, and are a "colonialist threat" to its sovereignty
In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law
The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats

items.title: What is driving US President’s Trump’s actions against Venezuela?
items.standfirst: Donald Trump declared Venezuela's airspace 'closed' on Saturday.
items.content: Donald Trump declared Venezuela's airspace 'closed' on Saturday.

items.title: Venezuela denounces ‘colonialist threat’ as Trump orders airspace closed
items.standfirst: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...

The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...

items.content: Venezuela has accused Donald Trump of making a "colonial threat," after the US president said the airspace "above and surrounding" the country should be considered closed "in its entirety".

items.title: Trump tells airlines Venezuela's airspace is 'closed in its entirety' in latest escalation

items.content: President Donald Trump said Saturday morning that Venezuela’s airspace should be considered “closed” as he weighs military action against the South American nation.

Venezuela demands respect for its airspace.

clusters.title: Hong Kong apartment fire death toll rises to 146 as city mourns victims
clusters.neutral_headline: Hong Kong Apartment Fire Death Toll Rises
bullet_summary: The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong has killed at least 146 people, authorities said Sunday, with around 40 still missing
Reported by Reuters Top News, CBS News, NBC World and others

items.title: Hong Kong apartment fire death toll rises to 146 as city mourns victims
items.standfirst: The death toll in Hong Kong's apartment complex blaze rose to 146 on Sunday as investigators discovered more bodies in the burned-out buildings. A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city's…
items.content: The death toll in Hong Kong's apartment complex blaze rose to 146 on Sunday as investigators discovered more bodies in the burned-out buildings. A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city's…

items.title: Death toll rises to 146 in Hong Kong apartment fire: "A wake-up call for everyone"
items.standfirst: Preliminary investigations showed the fire started Wednesday afternoon on a lower-level scaffolding net of one of the buildings, and then spread rapidly inside as the foam panels caught fire and blew out windows.
items.content: Preliminary investigations showed the fire started Wednesday afternoon on a lower-level scaffolding net of one of the buildings, and then spread rapidly inside as the foam panels caught fire and blew out windows.

items.title: More arrests made in Hong Kong corruption probe as fire death toll climbs to 146

items.content: The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong has killed at least 146 people, authorities said Sunday, with around 40 still missing

items.title: Death toll in Hong Kong apartment complex fire hits 146
items.standfirst: More than 100 people remain unaccounted for after seven high-rise buildings caught fire and burned for two days.
items.content: More than 100 people remain unaccounted for after seven high-rise buildings caught fire and burned for two days.

items.title: Death toll in Hong Kong housing estate fire rises to 146 as the city grieves
items.standfirst: The death toll from a devastating fire at a Hong Kong apartment complex blaze rose to at least 146 on Sunday as more bodies were recovered from the charred remains of the Wang Fuk Court buildings. More than a thousand people queued near the housing complex on Sunday to pay tribute to the victims.
items.content: The death toll from a devastating fire at a Hong Kong apartment complex blaze rose to at least 146 on Sunday as more bodies were recovered from the charred remains of the Wang Fuk Court buildings. More than a thousand people queued near the housing complex on Sunday to pay tribute to the victims.

items.title: Hong Kong mourns as apartment fire death toll rises to 146
items.standfirst: Rescue teams find more bodies in burnt-out buildings of Wang Fuk Court complex after Wednesday’s fireThe death toll in Hong Kong’s apartment complex fire has risen to 146 after investigators discovered more bodies in the burnt-out buildings. A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city’s history.The Hong Kong police’s disaster victim identification unit has been going through the buildings of the Wang Fuk Court complex meticulously and has found bodies both in apartment units and on the roofs, the officer in charge, Cheng Ka-chun, said on Sunday. Continue reading...

A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city’s history.The Hong Kong police’s disaster victim identification unit has been going through the buildings of the Wang Fuk Court complex meticulously and has found bodies both in apartment units and on the roofs, the officer in charge, Cheng Ka-chun, said on Sunday. Continue reading...

items.content: The death toll from a fire that tore through a Hong Kong apartment complex has risen.

clusters.title: Shooting at family gathering in Stockton kills 4, injures 11; shooter at large
clusters.neutral_headline: Shooting at Stockton Family Gathering Kills Four
bullet_summary: Three children were among the four people killed, the San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office said
Four people were killed and 11 were wounded in a shooting during a family gathering at a banquet hall in Stockton, California, sheriff’s officials said Saturday
Four people were killed and 10 wounded in a shooting during a family gathering at a banquet hall in Stockton, sheriff's officials said Saturday

items.title: Shooting at family gathering in Stockton kills 4, injures 11; shooter at large
items.standfirst: Three children were among the four people killed, the San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office said. The victims were 8, 9, 14, and 21 years old.
items.content: Three children were among the four people killed, the San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office said. The victims were 8, 9, 14, and 21 years old.

items.title: Three children among four killed in shooting at 'birthday party' in California
items.standfirst: Officials say 11 others are injured in what they believe is a "targeted" shooting at a children's birthday party.
items.content: Officials say 11 others are injured in what they believe is a "targeted" shooting at a children's birthday party.

items.title: Shooting at central California banquet hall leaves 4 people dead, 11 wounded
items.standfirst: Four people were killed and 11 were wounded in a shooting during a family gathering at a banquet hall in Stockton, California, sheriff’s officials said Saturday.
items.content: Four people were killed and 11 were wounded in a shooting during a family gathering at a banquet hall in Stockton, California, sheriff’s officials said Saturday.

items.title: California police search for suspect who killed four including three children at family party
items.standfirst: Victims who died in Stockton attack reportedly between ages eight and 21, while 11 others were woundedPolice are searching for the suspect who killed four people, including three children, and injured 11 in a shooting at a family gathering in Stockton, California, on Saturday night – and they are appealing to the public for any tips people may have.“If you have surveillance footage, if you’re a local business here, if you’re in the area, live in the area, or maybe you’ve heard rumors – please contact the sheriff’s office,” said Heather Brent, a spokesperson for the San Joaquin county sheriff’s office. Continue reading...
items.content: Victims who died in Stockton attack reportedly between ages eight and 21, while 11 others were woundedPolice are searching for the suspect who killed four people, including three children, and injured 11 in a shooting at a family gathering in Stockton, California, on Saturday night – and they are appealing to the public for any tips people may have.“If you have surveillance footage, if you’re a local business here, if you’re in the area, live in the area, or maybe you’ve heard rumors – please contact the sheriff’s office,” said Heather Brent, a spokesperson for the San Joaquin county sheriff’s office. Continue reading...

items.title: At least four dead and 10 wounded in California shooting
items.standfirst: At least four people were killed and 10 others wounded when gunfire erupted during a family gathering at a Stockton banquet hall Saturday evening, in what local authorities say may have been a "targeted attack".
items.content: At least four people were killed and 10 others wounded when gunfire erupted during a family gathering at a Stockton banquet hall Saturday evening, in what local authorities say may have been a "targeted attack".

clusters.title: Hondurans vote in close presidential race overshadowed by surprise Trump intervention
clusters.neutral_headline: Hondurans Vote Amid Trump Intervention
bullet_summary: President Donald Trump intervened in a close race with an endorsement of one candidate and announced that he would pardon a former president
Reported by Reuters Top News, BBC World, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Hondurans vote in close presidential race overshadowed by surprise Trump intervention
items.standfirst: Hondurans voted Sunday to elect a new president only days after U.S. President Donald Trump intervened in a close race with an endorsement of one candidate and announced that he would pardon a former president.
items.content: Hondurans voted Sunday to elect a new president only days after U.S. President Donald Trump intervened in a close race with an endorsement of one candidate and announced that he would pardon a former president.

items.content: The US president is threatening to cut aid to Honduras if his favoured right-wing presidential candidate does not win.

items.title: Hondurans to elect new president in tight race overshadowed by Trump
items.standfirst: Hondurans will elect a new president Sunday while still grappling with U.S. Donald Trump’s sudden intervention in what was expected to be a close contest, the latest signal of the United States’ renewed interest in Latin America. Among the five presidential candidates on the ballot, polls indicated three had a chance to win and were finishing in close competition.
items.content: Hondurans will elect a new president Sunday while still grappling with U.S. Donald Trump’s sudden intervention in what was expected to be a close contest, the latest signal of the United States’ renewed interest in Latin America. Among the five presidential candidates on the ballot, polls indicated three had a chance to win and were finishing in close competition.

items.title: Hondurans vote in presidential election overshadowed by Trump intervention
items.standfirst: Hondurans head to the polls Sunday to choose a new president in a tight, unpredictable race shaken by US President Donald Trump’s sudden intervention which underscored Washington’s renewed assertiveness in Latin America.
items.content: Hondurans head to the polls Sunday to choose a new president in a tight, unpredictable race shaken by US President Donald Trump’s sudden intervention which underscored Washington’s renewed assertiveness in Latin America.

ai_summary: Hondurans voted in a presidential election Sunday.
Trump intervened in the election with an endorsement.
Trump threatened to cut aid if his candidate loses.
Polls showed a close race between candidates.
The election is in a highly polarized climate.

clusters.title: Looting reported as Indonesia and Sri Lanka battle deadly floods
clusters.neutral_headline: Floods in Indonesia and Sri Lanka Cause Deaths
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, BBC World, Al Jazeera

items.title: Looting reported as Indonesia and Sri Lanka battle deadly floods

items.title: Kristi Noem claims suspect in national guard shooting was ‘radicalized’ in US
items.standfirst: Homeland security secretary also blamed ‘activist’ judges for defying court order to halt deportation flightsKristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, claimed on Sunday that the suspect in the national guard shooting in Washington DC was “radicalized” in the US and blamed the Biden administration, though the suspect’s asylum was approved under Donald Trump.The shooting suspect, 29-year-old Rahmanullah Lakanwal, was granted asylum under the Trump administration in April 2025. He worked with CIA backed units in Afghanistan, coming to the US in September 2021 under an Operation Allies Welcome program. Continue reading...
items.content: Homeland security secretary also blamed ‘activist’ judges for defying court order to halt deportation flightsKristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, claimed on Sunday that the suspect in the national guard shooting in Washington DC was “radicalized” in the US and blamed the Biden administration, though the suspect’s asylum was approved under Donald Trump.The shooting suspect, 29-year-old Rahmanullah Lakanwal, was granted asylum under the Trump administration in April 2025. He worked with CIA backed units in Afghanistan, coming to the US in September 2021 under an Operation Allies Welcome program. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Death toll passes 900 in Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka floods

Officials said the extent of the damage in the country’s worst-affected central region was slowly becoming clear on Sunday as relief workers cleared roads blocked by fallen trees and mudslides

items.title: Death toll passes 900 in Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka floods
items.standfirst: Officials in Indonesia say more than 442 people have died, while Sri Lanka suffers worst natural disaster since 2004 tsunami Authorities in Sri Lanka, Indonesia and Thailand are racing to clear debris and find hundreds of missing people after more than 900 died in devastating floods and landslides across the south of Asia.In the latest example of the impact of the climate crisis on storm patterns and extreme weather, heavy monsoon rains, exacerbated by a tropical storm, have overwhelmed parts of south-east Asia in recent days, leaving thousands of people stranded without shelter or critical supplies. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Sri Lanka reels from Cyclone Ditwah as death toll nears 200
items.standfirst: Entire areas of Sri Lanka's capital were flooded on Sunday after a powerful cyclone triggered heavy rains and mudslides across the island, with authorities reporting nearly 200 dead and dozens more missing. Officials said the extent of the damage in the country's worst-affected central region was only just being revealed as relief workers cleared roads blocked by fallen trees and mudslides.
items.content: Entire areas of Sri Lanka's capital were flooded on Sunday after a powerful cyclone triggered heavy rains and mudslides across the island, with authorities reporting nearly 200 dead and dozens more missing. Officials said the extent of the damage in the country's worst-affected central region was only just being revealed as relief workers cleared roads blocked by fallen trees and mudslides.

items.title: Sri Lanka death toll from floods and landslides reaches 153
items.standfirst: Another 191 missing after heavy rains from Cyclone Ditwah while almost 78,000 evacuated to temporary shelters amid rescue operationsTorrential rains and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah have killed 153 people across Sri Lanka so far, with another 191 still missing, the country’s Disaster Management Centre (DCM) said on Saturday.The DMC director general, Sampath Kotuwegoda, said relief operations were under way with 78,000 people moved to nearly 800 state-run welfare centres after their homes were destroyed by the week-long heavy rains. Continue reading...
items.content: Another 191 missing after heavy rains from Cyclone Ditwah while almost 78,000 evacuated to temporary shelters amid rescue operationsTorrential rains and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah have killed 153 people across Sri Lanka so far, with another 191 still missing, the country’s Disaster Management Centre (DCM) said on Saturday.The DMC director general, Sampath Kotuwegoda, said relief operations were under way with 78,000 people moved to nearly 800 state-run welfare centres after their homes were destroyed by the week-long heavy rains. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Hernández was convicted in 2024 of accepting millions in bribes to protect cocaine shipmentsDonald Trump has said he will grant a pardon to Juan Orlando Hernández, the former president of Honduras who is serving a 45-year prison sentence in the US on drug trafficking and weapons charges.“I will be granting a Full and Complete Pardon to Former President Juan Orlando Hernandez who has been, according to many people that I greatly respect, treated very harshly and unfairly,” Trump said on Friday in a post on Truth Social. Continue reading...
